unnormalised: In a shocking turn of events, local resident Mr. Sharma of Flat No. 420, Gali No. 69, Prem Nagar, Delhi - 69420, discovered his address was more than just a place to receive bills; it's apparently the hottest tourist spot this side of the Yamuna!
normalised: In a shocking turn of events, local resident Mister Sharma of Flat Number four hundred and twenty, Gali Number sixty nine, Prem Nagar, Delhi - six nine four two zero, discovered his address was more than just a place to receive bills; it's apparently the hottest tourist spot this side of the Yamuna!

unnormalised: "I woke up this morning to find a tour bus parked outside!" Mr. Sharma exclaimed, adjusting his reading glasses. "Apparently, some travel blog listed my humble abode as the 'Peak Indian Kitsch Experience: Authentic Delhi Living'."
normalised: "I woke up this morning to find a tour bus parked outside!" Mister Sharma exclaimed, adjusting his reading glasses. "Apparently, some travel blog listed my humble abode as the 'Peak Indian Kitsch Experience: Authentic Delhi Living'."

unnormalised: His neighbours, initially bewildered, have quickly adapted. Mrs. Gupta from House No. 13, Sector 4, Rohini, 110085, has started selling chai and pakoras to the bewildered tourists snapping photos of Sharma's overflowing balcony garden (which, let’s be honest, is mostly plastic flowers).
normalised: His neighbours, initially bewildered, have quickly adapted. Missus Gupta from House Number thirteen, Sector four, Rohini, one one zero zero eight five, has started selling chai and pakoras to the bewildered tourists snapping photos of Sharma's overflowing balcony garden (which, let’s be honest, is mostly plastic flowers).

unnormalised: The local auto-rickshaw drivers are charging exorbitant rates to "the iconic Sharma residence," according to sources at Auto Stand No. 7 near the metro station. One driver was heard saying, "₹500 for a 2-minute ride? It’s not just transportation; it's a cultural immersion, bhai!"
normalised: The local auto-rickshaw drivers are charging exorbitant rates to "the iconic Sharma residence," according to sources at Auto Stand Number seven near the metro station. One driver was heard saying, "rupee five hundred for a two-minute ride? It’s not just transportation; it's a cultural immersion, bhai!"

unnormalised: Even the local authorities seem amused, unofficially designating the area around Mr. Sharma's address as a "Selfie Zone." A nearby paan shop (Shop No. 9, behind Sharma's flat) is now selling commemorative "I <3 Gali No. 69" t-shirts.
normalised: Even the local authorities seem amused, unofficially designating the area around Mister Sharma's address as a "Selfie Zone." A nearby paan shop (Shop Number nine, behind Sharma's flat) is now selling commemorative "I love Gali Number sixty nine" t-shirts.

unnormalised: But Mr. Sharma is not amused. "I just wanted to watch my daily dose of 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah' in peace," he grumbled. "Now I have a family from Norway taking photos of my doorbell!" He’s reportedly filed a complaint at Police Station, Model Town, Delhi, 110009, requesting a de-listing of his address from the aforementioned (and currently untraceable) travel blog.
normalised: But Mister Sharma is not amused. "I just wanted to watch my daily dose of 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah' in peace," he grumbled. "Now I have a family from Norway taking photos of my doorbell!" He’s reportedly filed a complaint at Police Station, Model Town, Delhi, one one zero zero zero nine, requesting a de-listing of his address from the aforementioned (and currently untraceable) travel blog.

unnormalised: When asked for comment, the (possibly imaginary) travel blogger responded via carrier pigeon (address: Pigeon Coop No. 3, rooftop, unknown location) claiming, "It’s about authenticity, yaar! Where else can you find such a perfectly imperfect representation of Indian life? Besides, Flat No. 420 in Gali No. 69? The numbers alone are comedy gold!"
normalised: When asked for comment, the (possibly imaginary) travel blogger responded via carrier pigeon (address: Pigeon Coop Number three, rooftop, unknown location) claiming, "It’s about authenticity, yaar! Where else can you find such a perfectly imperfect representation of Indian life? Besides, Flat Number four hundred and twenty in Gali Number sixty nine? The numbers alone are comedy gold!"

unnormalised: So, if you're planning a trip to Delhi, skip the India Gate and head straight to Mr. Sharma’s. Just don't forget to bring your selfie stick and a strong sense of irony. Oh, and maybe some earplugs for Mr. Sharma's sake.
